[review]Hold up, press shift, x4. win. Receive some change. Do this 10+ times to 'level up' for bonus cash. No ranks or leaderboards. Most 'licensed' cars and parts cost too much and require higher levels. About the most detailed thing you do is tweak gear ratio. Cheap or not, it's mind-numbing.[/review]

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
												JDM Tuner Racing reminds me of a Flash game, and there's apparently a reason for that. According to other gamers who've bought this game, it's virtually identical to Drag Racer v3. Normally, I wouldn't fault a game for seeming similar to another, especially since there's only so many ways to design a game within the same genre. That said, JDMTR provides nothing new or of any value beyond the free Flash game that apparently inspired it. The basic concept behind JDMTR is illegal racing where you take normal cars, modify them way beyond the manufacturer's specifications (which is dangerous in real life) while adding various bits of ridiculous design elements, such as an overly large spoiler.That alone would make for a fine game (and in fact, it's worked in other games), but JDMTR breaks down immediately once you start playing it. How so? Allow me to explain...There is NO documentation, tutorial, or any instructions/guides whatsoever. The game itself isn't difficult to play, but many features within it — such as knowing how to fine tune your gear shift — or explaining certain acronyms (i.e. NOS) and initialisms (i.e. RPM) are left entirely up to the player to figure out. The menu system is confusing and clunky to use. For instance, there's a section entitled "setup," which most gamers will assume means "this is the options menu." Not so in JDMTR. This section lets you tune your gear shift, but like I explained before, offers no guidance on what any of it means or how it works. The money you earn while playing lets you purchase new vehicles and upgrade components. The problem with this is there's no "undo" function. Some people might say, "There's a downgrade option to solve this!" Well, yes and no. Downgrading will get rid of the last upgrade you bought and installed; however, it won't refund any of the money you spent, so downgrading leaves you worse off than before. The graphics are passable, but static and look at least a decade out of date, if not more so. Honestly, the graphics in JDMTR are the least of its issues, which doesn't say much for it.The actual gameplay is extremely limited and as far as I can tell, is entirely keyboard-only except for navigating the menus, which uses the mouse. Racing consists of pushing "up" on the arrow keys, while "left shift" will shift into a higher gear (oddly enough, you can't downshift) and the "alt" key will fire NOS. Aside from clicking on menus, that's all the gameplay present in JDMTR. Now to be fair, there is a positive to JDMTR: It's incredibly cheap (normally priced at 99 cents USD, and I got it on sale for 69 cents USD) so at absolute worst, you've wasted one solitary dollar. You can't buy anything for a dollar nowadays, not even a cup of coffee or a bottle of soda.So would I recommend JDM Tuner Racing? Absolutely not. Save yourself some money and go play the free Flash game version instead.

Concluding, it's a waste of money and a waste of time. Please do not purchase this game.

Posted: July 5, 2016
												The game is a bit broken, I wish the speedometer was in MPH and not KMH, also you can set the rev points and such for each gear which is definitely a great idea but can be used to your advantage. (In my case I used the max revs to 11,000, which in the long run no car could compete with mine except 1 or 2 here and there). Sounds are on point and stuff but shifting and stuff just isn't all there, if you accidentally shift to early you can't downshift and comeback from such a messup.. instead you just get burned and lose the race sadly.Good idea and stuff behind the game, but getting levels and money just isn't all there. However it can be improved by adding more of a fun motive to the game like having people on social media setup street races with you and such, and then them replying back to you, etc.. something to make the game fun as well as getting your car up there.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
Product received for free
												This isnt a bad game. It's addictive, but it has a bunch of problems and glitches. I cant move, enlarge or rotate my decals at all. The speedometer glitches, too. There also seem to have some stolen assets here and there. Which wouldn't be so bad if it was a free game, but this is a game you usually buy!It might have a lot of glitches, but JDM Tuner Racing is enjoyable. That being said, I still don't recommend it for a good reason.This game is a clone of the Drag Racer games, which are good and free flash games. The problem is that JDM Tuner Racing isnt as good as Drag Racer, so why buy it?? Just go play Drag Racer V3, it's a better experience.To conclude, JDM Tuner Racing, even though it's not that bad, is not worth buying for the simple reason that the game it is supposed to copy is better and free. Don't waste your money on this. Only get this game if it's for free, or if you are really curious.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
Product received for free
												Cute drag racer. The setup and tuning part is interesting, albeit simple... It translates any kind of upgrade to raw horsepower... So, getting spoilers, lowering the car, getting lighter wheels don't affect the car's acceleration neither top speed. Adding turbo, changing shafts or the piston heads add to the car's total HP... The only actual input the game needs are the correct gear ratio for your car and timed shifts. The game even throttles automatically for you. Most likely because this looks like a mobile game port.It's a good passtime though. It'd look better on a mobile, but it can provide a 5-minute passtime if needed.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2016
Product received for free
												JDM Tuner Racing is a Blatantly obvious remake of the flash game Drag Racer V3DRV3 was a game from my childhood since it's been around for as long as I can remember, but its awesome.I always wanted to have it for roadtrips and times I couldn't be online, and this would've been great when I was younger and wanted it.Pro's:- Looks WAY better than the original- Limited controls makes it pretty easy and fun (for a short time)- Worth getting on sale- Has some funny parts that look ridiculous while still staying true to the original- Definitely NostalgicCon's:- Gets old really quick- Some low rez textures (obviously)- Somewhat unoriginal.Conclusions/Ideas.I reccomend you get this game if you have some spare cash in your account or you see it for free somewhere, Maybe they should get a story mode or championships like the old one has? to give some push and progression. Also bring back the ability to make the car stupidly low and the wheels way to big as that was so funny. (Also I'm pretty sure this wasn't made by the original developers, so sorry for acting like it was).
